name: the grid os
short_description:
This project is aimed at designing an operating system that bridges all types of online communications into one secure, open, collaborative, and private fashion, learning from things like PGP, Tor, VPN, and a revisit of what we allow in the form of keylogging, ip access, file access from varying programs instead of just users, encrypted filesystems, and a revisit to security by learning from the behavior of viruses that have existed on such a system.  

This will require a fork of the linux kernel, or kernel of some other operating system, and will require rewrites of parts of the kernel.

This project exists because it has never been more important to ensure the security, privacy, and anonymmity of online communications and activity.  Anyone on the grid os should be able to have this handled for them automatically, instead of having to set up such a system.

If you would like to put this project in motion, join.
summary: learning from over 20 years of failures
